name: Savos Aren

other_aspects: Keeper of the College's Ancient Knowledge

stunts: Arcane Authority: +2 to Rapport when commanding respect as Arch-Mage
Forbidden Knowledge: Once per session, recall obscure magical lore that provides critical advantage
Master of All Schools: Can cast spells from any magical school with +1 bonus
notes: Savos Aren is the Arch-Mage of the College of Winterhold, a position he holds with great burden. Decades ago, he and a group of students ventured into Saarthal and encountered something terrible. He was the only survivor, and the experience haunts him. He's a powerful mage but politically weakened, forced to accept the Thalmor advisor Ancano as the price of the College's continued operation. He's increasingly isolated and stressed by his responsibilities.
combat_tactics: Savos uses high-level destruction magic and protective wards. He's experienced and versatile but his guilt and stress may make him hesitate. He'll prioritize protecting the College and its students over his own safety.

starting_equipment.weapon: Staff of Magnus replica (Weapon:3, legendary artifact copy)

social_interaction: Savos appears calm and authoritative but carries deep weariness. He's diplomatic and thoughtful, choosing words carefully. With those he trusts, hints of his burden show through. He respects magical scholarship and judges people by their dedication to knowledge. He's frustrated by political necessities that distract from the College's true purpose.

motivations: Protect the College from external threats
Prevent anyone else from suffering Saarthal's fate
fears: The Eye of Magnus falling into wrong hands
personality_notes.character_growth: May finally share Saarthal burden, find peace through mentoring successor, or sacrifice himself to protect College

saarthal_secret.event: Years ago, led expedition to Saarthal with five students
saarthal_secret.discovery: Encountered powerful magical entity/artifact that killed all students except Savos
saarthal_secret.survivor_guilt: Blames himself for their deaths, sealed away what they found
saarthal_secret.current_threat: Knows that the Eye of Magnus could bring similar catastrophe
saarthal_secret.burden: Cannot share full truth without revealing College's dangerous secrets

college_leadership_role.public_face: Maintains College's reputation and independence in hostile Skyrim
college_leadership_role.internal_role: Oversees research, approves expeditions, maintains ancient wards
college_leadership_role.political_burden: Must negotiate with Jarls, Thalmor, and skeptical Nords
college_leadership_role.thalmor_compromise: Allowed Ancano as advisor to prevent College being shut down
college_leadership_role.delegation: Relies heavily on Mirabelle for day-to-day operations due to stress

whiterun_mission_connection.objective: Savos approves Tolfdir's mission to send PC to assist Farengar, seeing dragon crisis as potentially catastrophic magical event
whiterun_mission_connection.concern: Dragons returning suggests massive magical disturbance - College must understand and prepare
whiterun_mission_connection.resources: Authorizes PC to use College resources and authority when working with Farengar
whiterun_mission_connection.hope: PC might be capable enough to handle threats without suffering like his students did

story_hooks: Grants access to restricted sections of College library
Reveals information about ancient magical threats
May request PC investigate Saarthal when ready
Provides powerful magical items from College vault in emergencies
Could appoint PC as successor if he falls
Connection to Eye of Magnus storyline

dialogue_samples.greeting: Welcome to the College of Winterhold. I am Savos Aren, Arch-Mage. The pursuit of magical knowledge is our highest calling - but it must be tempered with wisdom.
dialogue_samples.approving_mission: Tolfdir speaks highly of you. These dragon sightings... they concern me deeply. Magic of that magnitude doesn't simply reappear without cause. Go to Whiterun, assist Farengar Secret-Fire, and learn what you can. The College must understand what's happening.
dialogue_samples.burden: Leadership is... heavier than I imagined when I was young. Every decision affects so many lives. One must be cautious, thoughtful. Mistakes... mistakes can be devastating.
dialogue_samples.ancano: The Thalmor 'advisor' is a necessary inconvenience. The College's survival sometimes requires... compromises. But I watch him carefully.
dialogue_samples.saarthal_hint: Some knowledge is dangerous. Some places should remain sealed. I learned this truth at great cost, long ago.

neutral_faction_integration.starting_narrative: Arch-Mage Savos Aren personally approves your assignment to Whiterun. 'The return of dragons is no coincidence,' he tells you gravely. 'This could threaten all of Skyrim. The College must be involved. Go to Farengar - learn what he's discovered, and report back.'
neutral_faction_integration.transition_to_battle: When the Battle of Whiterun erupts during your mission, Savos's words echo in your mind about threats that transcend politics. Yet now you must choose a side.
neutral_faction_integration.consequences: Your choice affects how the winning faction views the College and whether they'll support or oppose magical research in their territory.
